BinaryIndexedTree

public BinaryIndexedTree(int size)
Creates a new BinaryIndexedTree with max index the smallest power of 2 larger than the given size.

Parameters:
size - the size
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size is not greater than 0
Method Detail

ensureIndex

public void ensureIndex(int index)
If this BinaryIndexedTree doesn't maintain a frequency for the given index, it is expanded to do so.

Parameters:
index - the index

public long getCumulativeFrequency(int index)

Parameters:

getIndex

public int getIndex(long cumulativeFrequency)
Returns the highest index with the given cumulative frequency (i.e., the last index with non-zero frequency). If no index has exactly the given frequency, then if x is the index with the next highest cumulative frequency, -(x+1) is returned.

Parameters:
cumulativeFrequency - the cumulative frequency
Returns:
the index

update

public long update(int index,
                   long count)
Updates the frequency of the given index in this BinaryIndexedTree by adding the given count.

Parameters:
index - the index
count - the count
Returns:
the new frequency at the given index
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if update would introduce a negative frequency to this BinaryIndexedTree
